title: Oral Hygiene and Cleaning
feature: How many times do you visit a dentist for a cleaning and general checkup? Regular hygiene visits are really important as these appointments provide your teeth and gums with a thorough cleaning, inspection, and preventative maintenance.
description: Our dentists highly recommend that patients should see us at least twice a year. During your visit, a dental hygienist will complete a thorough teeth cleaning using specific tools: brushing, removing built-up plaque, scraping under the gum line, polishing and flossing. The hygienist will also go over how to properly take care of your teeth or your child’s teeth at home.

title: Teeth Whitening
feature: Who doesn't love a white pearl smile? But our lifestyle, diet and aging can change the colour of your teeth gradually which may negatively affect your confidence. Teeth Whitening is a procedure carried out at our clinic to help you fight teeth discoloration
description: Teeth whitening is an increasingly popular procedure and undoubtedly a fantastic confidence-booster. It allows us to remove or reduce stains, lightening teeth for a more attractive appearance.We have done countless of Teeth Whitening procedures for our clients and the feedback is overwhelmingly positive. We can't wait to bring that joy and confidence to you too!

title: Dental Implants
feature: Having a missing tooth or maybe even a couple of missing teeth? Dental Implants may be the the answer you're looking for.
description: Dental Implants are titanium posts/frames that are surgically positioned by our dentist into the jawbone just underneath the gum and act as a tooth root. Once they correctly sit in place, our dentist can mount the replacement teeth (crown) onto the metal post, giving you a new set of teeth/tooth.

title: Invisalign
feature: If your teeth are not as straight as you would like them or if you have spacing between your teeth consider Invisalign clear braces that can straighten your smile with out the use of metal brackets!
description: Invisalign is an orthodontic treatment that relies on a series of trays (aligners) to move your teeth into the desired position. They are created from plastics that are detachable, practically invisible and custom-built for your teeth.

title: Root Canal Treatment
feature: You may require a root canal if tooth decay progresses and damages the nerve of your tooth
description: Underneath the enamel, your tooth has pulpy and soft matter. Inside this pulp is a collection of nerves, connective tissue, and blood vessels. The pulp can get infected in a variety of ways, often caused by a crack, chip in your tooth, or deep decay. At this point, it is frequently necessary to remove it from the canal space in the root of your tooth. Then, the space is disinfected and filled. The root canal treatment facilitates the restoration of the natural comfort and function of your tooth.

title: Crowns & Bridges
feature: If your tooth already contains several fillings — or has a large amount of decay — A crown could be an alternative suggestion.
description: Dental bridges and crowns are permanent, prosthetic appliances that are bonded onto existing teeth or implants to cover an area where one or more teeth are missing, chipped or discoloured.
